alert.note: Alert for Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 10:39PM EST until December 19 at 12:55PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Hampshire...Vermont... Connecticut River At Wells River affecting Orange, Grafton and Caledonia Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Wells River. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Hundreds of acres of farmland in New Hampshire and Vermont are flooded from Monroe to Fairlee. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:16 PM EST Monday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:16 PM EST Monday was 11.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 12.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight to 8.7 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will rise to 10.3 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
